alert.note: Alert for Eagle; Garfield; Pitkin (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 10 at 11:52AM MST by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR A POTENTIAL ICE JAM IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam is possible. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Colorado and west central Colorado, including the following counties, in northwest Colorado, Eagle and Garfield. In west central Colorado, Pitkin. * WHEN...Until 1145 PM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Anglers and anyone near or in the Roaring Fork River should use extreme caution and be on the lookout for ice and debris flowing in the river. Move away from the river and seek higher ground as necessary. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1148 AM MST, A potential ice jam near the advisory area was reported with minor flooding becoming possible. These conditions could linger through the weekend into early next week.
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Emergency management and law enforcement are asking all citizens to use extreme caution in and around the Roaring Fork River.
